title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement meteorodata@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: outlines propose change meteorodata. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("MatiFasolato/meteorodata", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: Please note meteorodata project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos
title: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos
text: El objetivo del paquete ‘meteorodata’ es facilitar el análisis de datos meteorológicos y la manipulación de los mismos mediante funciones implementadas en este paquete.

title: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos
text: can install development version meteorodata GitHub :

title: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos
text: Este es un ejemplo básico que muestra cómo instalar la librería del paquete:
code: library(meteorodata)  F_to_C(100) #> [1] 37.77778  estacion_met <- descargar_datos("NH0098") #> Descargando y leyendo el archivo de estacion 'NH0098' en el directorio #> temporal. head(estacion_met,5) #>       id      fecha temperatura_abrigo_150cm temperatura_abrigo_150cm_maxima #> 1 NH0098 1956-04-01                    13.65                            21.6 #> 2 NH0098 1956-04-02                    16.75                            23.6 #> 3 NH0098 1956-04-03                    19.00                            25.9 #> 4 NH0098 1956-04-04                    17.55 #> 1                                 NA                          NA #> 2                                 NA                          NA #> 3                                 NA                          NA #> 4                                 NA                          NA #> 5                                 NA                          NA #>   temperatura_suelo_10cm_media temperatura_inte_5cm #> 1 4                                  NA            NA                           0 #> 5                                  NA            NA                           0 #>   granizo nieve heliofania_efectiva heliofania_relativa tesion_vapor_media #> 1       0     0                  NA                  NA                8.3 #> 2       0     0                  NA                  NA what: Conversión de la temperatura en Centigrados a Fahrenheit — C_to_F
title: Conversión de la temperatura en Centigrados a Fahrenheit — C_to_F
text: La función C_to_F() toma un valor numérico de la temperatura en Centigrados y calcula la equivalencia en grados fahrenheit.

title: Conversión de la temperatura en Centigrados a Fahrenheit — C_to_F

text: temp_centigrado un vector numérico de la temperatura en Centigrados

text: Los datos son generados de manera aleatoria. muestra de datos b muestra de datos multiplicada por 5

title: Conjunto de datos de ejemplo — datos
text: Fuente: generación propia con funciones de R.

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
text: Este conjunto de datos incluye muestras de diferentes estaciones meteorológicas, obtenidas de un repositorio en GitHub. La funcion descargar_datos() toma 2 parametros y permite la lectura y/o descarga del dataset de la estacion que se solicite.

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
text: Un dataframe con las siguientes estaciones y columnas: NH0098 Datos de la estación meteorológica "NH0098". NH0437 Datos de la estación meteorológica "NH0437". NH0046 Datos de la estación meteorológica "NH0046". NH0910 Datos de la estación meteorológica "NH0910". NH0472 Datos de la estación meteorológica "NH0472". NH_unidos Datos combinados de todas las estaciones.

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
text: Repositorio de GitHub.

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
text: id_estacion un string conformado por numeros y letras

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
text: Devuelve la informacion contenida en el dataset descargado

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
text: Estaciones Disponibles: NH0437 NH0098 NH0046 NH0910 NH0472

title: Datos de estaciones meteorológicas — descargar_datos
code: data <- descargar_datos("NH0098") #> Descargando y leyendo el archivo de estacion 'NH0098' en el directorio #> temporal.

what: Grafico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
title: Grafico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
text: Esta funcion recibe un data frame con datos de una o mas estaciones y devuelve un grafico con el promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo 150 cm.

title: Grafico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
Grafico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
text: datos el data frame que contiene la informacion de todas las estaciones meteorologicas. colores un vector de colores para utilizar en el grafico. titulo un string con el titulo del grafico. Si se define, el titulo por defecto sera "Temperatura".

title: Grafico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
text: Un grafico con el promedio mensual de la temperatura.

title: Grafico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual

title: Tabla de resumen para la/s estacion/es meteorologicas — tabla_resumen_temperatura
code: # Supomemos que queremos obtener la tabla de resumen de NH0910 y NH0437: tabla_resumen_temperatura(NH_unidos,c('NH0910','NH0437')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   id     observaciones_temperatura proporcion_NA temperatura_minima #>   <chr>                      <int>         <dbl>              <dbl> #> 1 NH0437                     18738       0.0101                 2.1 #> 2 NH0910                     15506       0.00302                0   #> # ℹ 3 more variables: temperatura_maxima <dbl>, temperatura_promedio <dbl>, #> #   desviacion_estandar <dbl>
